The window lowered as soon as the car stopped at the drive-thru speaker. A minute screeching came from the other side, “Hi. Welcome to McBurgertown. How may I serve you?”

Bonnie Swanson, wife to Joe Swanson, stuck her head out of the window, “I’ll have a small chicken salad and a medium cup of water.” She said retreating into the car biting her lip. The teenager on the other side repeated the order for clarity and as polite as it was, he just had to ask, “Is that all?” Bonnie, of course, knew it damn well wasn’t.

“I’ll have a two number nines. A number nine large. A number six with extra dip. A number seven. Two number forty fives, one with cheese…and a large soda…and another large diet soda.” She drew herself back into the car with an exasperated sigh. Bonnie drove up to the drive thru window and collected her once reasonable order now feast for a family of five and put it into the car.

One employee stepped by the drive-thru window, “Did she do that order again?” The other stood by, “Yeah.” Another moment, “Did she not pay again?” Again, “Nope.”

“Man, corporate does not give a fuck.”

Paper bags crinkled loudly from Bonnie’s hands ruffling around for any type of greasy nourishment. She consumed with messy abandon, leaving condiment splatters remain on her puffy face and crumbs tumbling down onto her billowing cleavage. Bonnie took the top bun from a burger and piled on as many fries and onion rings onto it as possible then pressing the bun on to once more to eat the self made combination, “Ah! So good!”

While Bonnie eats, an explanation for her sudden growth in appetite is in order. Bonnie, during her pregnancy, used to be able to control her appetite. Aerobic class combined with a low carb diet kept her figure in check while carrying her his cooking skills and positive attitude.
Yet, as most failed crash diets would have it. Bonnie partook in a slice of cheese cake while attending a party thrown by the Griffins. She carelessly enjoyed it. She enjoyed it with much ecstasy. It was the first tasteful sin she’s had in a long time! That one measely slip-up on her diet flung her down a slippery slope of odd cravings and never satisfying appetite. Late night fast food trips and as many deserts as she could get her hands on changed her figure.

At first, a little ten pounds found its home around her hips and breasts. Bonnie didn’t mind the extra wiggle and bounce in her stride. Joe seemed to like it more than she did. Then came the massive cravings for carbs. Beef-dipped sandwiches, double battered fries, dozens of donuts all for a simple snack after nothing for hours. Bonnie’s little ten pound gain blew up into a fourty-five pound weight gain she had a while ago. Her trademark purple dress had clung tightly around her body like saran wrap.
At this point, house chores became tiring and taxing on Bonnie. Her dress would become drenched in sweat by the time she had finished dusting the house. Yet, after every little chore she rewarded herself with a feast of pizza. The pizza came from Joe who had a pizza overlord delivery man in custody yet released him for the code for unlimited pizza.

There was concern about the unlimited pizza and Bonnie’s weight. Yet, as stated by Joe Swanson, “My wife gets what she wants. And if she wants a man with working legs then I’m pretty much screwed.”

This when Bonnie’s weight had ballooned from the forty five pound gain to one hundred and ten. Making her tip the scales at two hundred and thirty five pounds. Sure, it would’ve been a wakeup call having to climb up several dress sizes in a short amount of time, but nobody seemed to mind. Bonnie wasn’t disturbed by the questions from her friends and Joe’s never ending love kept her happy.

We know meet back with Bonnie, who is reclining in her car after scarfing down that incredible fast food feast. Her hands rub all over her distended, yet well fed stomach to ease the digestion. “Huff. I gotta start going easy on those onion ring poppers.

Just as her eyes nearly met to put her to slumber, a loud “HURRAY” came from somewhere close, “Huh? What was that?”

Bonnie looks outside to see…

14523.content:
Jillian sat at the lone park bench, her face buried in her hands, "Oh, where will I find a job?" a choke fighting back the tears. She despised the thought of moving back in with her parents and being known as the only girl in her group without a occupation. Her weak brain thought, thought, and thought, yet nothing came to her. She wiped a single tear from her eye and had admitted that there wouldn't be many job opportunities for someone like her.

She stood and wiped the dried, crumpled bird droppings from the back of her pants and headed for her car. Then suddenly, like out of a poorly written movie, a newspaper smacks her in the face and literally shoved the information that would turn her day around. "A management position at McBurgertown!" she cried with hope welling inside of her, "And no experience necessary? I'm there!" Jillian took of sprinting towards her car and drove towards the nearest McBurgertown.

The tires screeched when Jillian slammed on the brakes and flung herself outward to the double doors of the McBurgertown. Inside, the manager stood in the lobby with his eyes half open and his arms crossed. "HellomynamesJillianandIwantthisjobreallybadly!" Jillian sputtered, absolutely out of breath. The manager wrinkled his mustache, "Do you have a criminal record?".

"Erm, no." Jillian responded.

"Okay, then the jobs yours. First your job is to clean out the deep fryer and throw away all of these unsold double cheeseburger." He said turning back to his office. Jillian saw the boxes filled with burgers that the teenage workers had not cared for, she felt that her new boss told her to get to it since there was no way they were going to do it. She lifted the boxes one by one to the back where the dumpster was nestled comfortably in the brick corner. It took her a few hours, but the job was nearly completed. All that was left was one box and to clean out the fryer and a days work would be done.

At the moment the Lunch Lady placed the weight gain formula into Connie's food, Meg ran back to the cafeteria. As soon as she was gone, the Lunch Lady did her normal business. It was then that Connie came in and said, "Hey, lady, give me my food." "Here's your grub, Connie." she said as she gave her food.

"Thanks. Maybe you're not so useless after all. No, wait. You are!" Connie snapped as she left. "Annoying little bitch." she snarled under her breath. The lunch Lady couldn't stand Connie neither.

Once Connie had her food, Meg sat a few tables back. She snickered as she thought about how big she's get. Then her waiting paid off as Connie took her first bite. "Mmm. That ugly bitch actually made something tasty for a change." the yellow-haired brat chuckled.

But once she finished it, she felt a tingling inside her body. Then her arms began to wobble and jiggle as they slowly started filling up. "WHAT THE HELL??!" she shrieked as she saw her arms now as wide as dictionaries.

Meg was cracking up as she watched Connie's swelling. Watching Connie growing so big was better than watching Operation Repo. "There's a new definition of obese, and it's Connie." she said under her snickering. For Meg, her fun was only getting started. Connie screamed as her arms burst out of her sleeves. Watching the purple pieces of fabric fly, Connie gasped in horror at her new arms. They were thick as a beagle's body. "Oh my God! My arms look like sausages!" she cried. But her growth wasn't over yet. Soon her stomach began to swell like a balloon.

Starting small, it reached as wide as a beach-ball in only two minutes. Then it ballooned larger. Her friends gasped as Connie's bigger stomach began to ooze onto the table. Then they ran and screamed as it completely crushed one half of the table.

"Wait! Come back!" Connie screamed to her friends. Her face started swelling too. Her cheeks looked like apples. How big will she get?

info.description:
Welp, it looks like the females in the Family Guy Universe are beginning to gain weight whether they like it or not. The fun part is, you choose how it happens and who it happens to. Just a few rules:
